intro: Rhynchospora macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features slender, grass-like stems and produces spike-like inflorescences with small, greenish flowers. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in moist, often acidic environments. Rhynchospora macrocarpa plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
